Premise: If the sky is cloudy, it will rain.
If it snows today, then the schools declare a holiday.
The sky is either cloudy or it snows today.
Hypothesis: It will rain or the schools declare a holiday.
Label: True

Premise: If we reach the museum on time, we can see all the artworks displayed.
If we go to the museum on a Sunday, then the museum will be closed.
We reach the museum on time or we go to the museum on a Sunday.
Hypothesis: We can see all the artworks displayed or the museum will be closed.
Label: True

Premise: If the episode of the show releases today, then he will watch the episode.
If it does not rain today, then he will play cricket with his friends.
The episode of the show releases today or it does not rain today.
Hypothesis: He will watch the episode or he will play cricket with his friends.
Label: True

Premise: If I win a million dollars, I will donate it to an orphanage.
If my friend wins a million dollars, he will donate it to a wildlife fund.
Either I win a million dollars or my friend wins a million dollars.
Hypothesis: Therefore, either an orphanage will get a million dollars, or a wildlife fund will get a million dollars.
Label: True

Premise: If I come first in the race, I get a bicycle as a prize.
If my friend gets a promotion, then he will celebrate it with a party.
Either I come first in the race or my friend gets a promotion.
Hypothesis: Therefore, either I get a bicycle as a prize or my friend will celebrate his promotion with a party.
Label: True
